thread.title: Nasdaq center aims to build relationships with startups
thread.title_full: Nasdaq center aims to build relationships with startups - newsR

author: newsr.in
title: Nasdaq center aims to build relationships with startups
text: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Nasdaq has long been known as the "tech-heavy" stock exchange, where some of Silicon Valley's best-known companies have gone to sell shares. [...] as it faces stiff competition from rival exchanges to lure the next hot IPO, it's reaching out to business startups before they go public. The move comes as Nasdaq's chief rival, the New York Stock Exchange, has increased its outreach to the tech sector in recent years and has lured some high-profile startups like Twitter, which held its initial public offering on the NYSE in 2013. The new center fills 13,000 square feet of remodeled space that includes meeting areas, a media training studio where founders can develop videos to promote their companies, and a coffee shop for casual networking. »
